question: A rocket is shot from the top of a tower at an angle of 45° above the horizontal (Fig. 19-1). It hits the ground in 5 seconds at a horizontal distance from the foot of the tower equal to three times the height of the tower. Find the height of the tower.<image 1>
description: The image depicts a diagram illustrating the trajectory of a projectile launched from the top of a tower. The tower has a height denoted as \( h \). The projectile is launched at an angle of 45 degrees above the horizontal. The projectile's path is shown as a curved line, indicating its parabolic motion. The projectile lands on the ground at a horizontal distance from the base of the tower, which is given as \( 3h \). The time taken for the projectile to hit the ground is stated as 5 seconds. The figure is labeled as "Fig. 19-1". The problem involves using kinematic equations related to projectile motion to determine the height \( h \) of the tower. The options provided for the height \( h \) are: A. \( h = 100 \) ft, B. \( h = 80 \) ft, C. \( h = 110 \) ft, D. \( h = 85 \) ft.
